#Text=WHO declares Ebola outbreak an international emergency
#Text=Monday , August 11 , 2014
#Text=On Friday , the World Health Organisation ( WHO ) stated the West African Ebola outbreak is now an international health emergency .

#Text=The current ongoing outbreak of Ebola is the deadliest since the disease was first reported in humans 40 years ago , with nearly 1,000 people reported to have been killed by the disease in this outbreak .
#Text=So far three countries , Sierra Leone , Liberia , and Nigeria , have declared national emergencies in response to the outbreak , with cases also reported in Guinea .

#Text=The latter country was reported to have closed its borders with Sierra Leone and Liberia , but an official announcement later clarified they were taking medical precautions on border crossings .
#Text=Dr Margaret Chan , Director General of WHO
#Text=Image : January .

#Text=Director-General of WHO Dr Margaret Chan appealed for an international response to the outbreak , calling it " the largest , most severe and most complex outbreak in the nearly four-decade history of this disease " .

#Text=Reports say the comparatively underdeveloped medical infrastructure in the affected countries has hampered efforts to contain the spread of the virus , with Liberia 's health system particularly under-equipped for the pressure .
#Text=Medecins sans Frontieres ( MSF ) said the health system in Liberia was " falling apart " .
#Text=Health experts and aid workers from Europe and America are already working to help bring the outbreak under control , but MSF and WHO are now calling for more help .

#Text=The announcement by WHO has international law implications , and it is expected possible cases will not be allowed to leave the countries affected until it is confirmed they are clear of the virus , with the possibility of travel being denied from any region not meeting the WHO 's guidelines .

#Text=WHO have also warned all nations should prepare to bring their own nationals back to home territory for treatment if infected by the virus , with cases already returned for treatment to the US and Spain .
#Text=WHO vaccine chief Jean-Marie Okwo Bele told AFP he expected a possible vaccine against Ebola to start clinical trials next month , stating :
#Text=" Since this is an emergency , we can put emergency procedures in place [ ... ] so that we can have a vaccine available by 2015 " .

#Text=WHO assistant director-general Marie-Paule Kieny admitted , however , to do so the bar set during the testing process would have to be lower , reflecting questions about the ethics of using comparatively untested drugs , and who they should be given to .
#Text=Meanwhile , restrictions put in place to limit the spread of the disease are reported to be causing problems among those affected in already impoverished areas .

#Text=Liberia and Sierra Leone are both reported to have deployed soldiers to limit travel within these countries , with many residents reported to be worried about the effect on their trade and incomes .
#Text=The Telegraph reported from interviews , there is also resistance to some measures in Liberia , where there is a strong stigma attached to the disease .
#Text=This has led to many people refusing to report the deaths of family members and hand their bodies over for cremation .
#Text=There have also been cases of violence towards those seeking to enforce government measures to limit the disease 's spread .
